5.9. 
Consequences of the annulment of the right of succession
1. When a court decision not to recognise a person claiming the succession as heir entitled to the succession has become final, that person shall be deemed not to have accepted the succession.
2. If the action is brought by an heir who is entitled to inherit, he shall be deemed to have accepted the succession, unless the action is brought in the interests of other heirs.
3. The other heirs who would be entitled to inherit upon the entry into force of the judgment referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article shall have the right to accept the succession within three months from the date of entry into force of the judgment.
4. For new heirs, the succession shall be deemed to have occurred as from the moment of the occurrence of the succession (Article 5.3 of this Code).
